Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2008 07:52AM Fammy5 wrote: Good morning ladies... (it's morning time here in jersey) ... First, I want to thank Karen for stopping by and proving to us that there is light at the end of the tunnel...  that was very sweet of you. ilovemykids:  I pray that your oncotype score is low...  this whole thing is definitely a rollercoaster ride of emotions... there are many times where i'll cry to my sister and tell her that I keep thinking this is all a nightmare and eventually i'll get up from it..  there are other times when i'm feeling extremely positive and strong knowing that with God's will, i'll get through this and it WILL be like a bad dream that's over.  Hang in there... we're going to have our good and bad days.. but we have to make the best out of it.. keeping ourselves busy with our children and our lives helps a lot.  Living one day at a time and taking everything as it comes along also makes a big difference.  you'll get through this, and prepare yourself ahead of time for all the side effects so you know that you did the best you can.  bourscheid.. my stomach is starting to turn just thinking that we're starting in two days.. yet i'm anxious to start and get this over with.  Teena:  i'm not sure exactly how you're supposed to use the tea tree oil, but i assume you rub it on your nails and toe nails to avoid neuropathy.  i'll double check and get back to you on that.  Those of you starting today, Good luck and we're waiting to hear from you! enjoy your day ladies... fammy
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2008 07:14AM Fammy5 wrote: Good luck today praying hands..  be strong, and it'll pass... I start tomorrow  ... hope everyone else is doing well!

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2008 04:43PM Fammy5 wrote: Hey girls... I know I haven't posted in a couple of days... but u've all been on my mind.. and the fact that other people are feeling exactly what i'm feeling now puts my heart at ease...  i'm counting down the days till oct. 2nd and i'm slowly starting to lose control of my nerves...(unfortunately)....  i'm trying to look ahead and think to myself it's only 4 months... and it'll be over.. I can't wait to go back to my normal life again and be the mom and the wife that I once was..  God willing, we'll all get through this... has anyone already started ? Fammy
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2008 04:56PM Fammy5 wrote: Welcome to the group terilee.  It's nice seeing more teachers here in the group!  I teach 4-6 grade math.  I love every minute of it.  My students are being very supportive as well, and they all brought in hand sanitizers and tissue boxes to put on each and every desk.. I take protegra anti-oxidant multivitamin.  My doctor also ordered me to take Vitamin D because the level of Vitamin D in my body is so low.  I took my neulasta shot yesterday and my body is aching like there's no tomorrow... any suggestions on making this achy body get better? tylenol didn't do much... :( i hope i'm feeling better by tomorrow to go back to work... thanks for listening all and have a great day!

Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2008 07:53AM Fammy5 wrote: Cheryl -  you're in my thoughts and prayers.. Hopefully this time will be easier on you.  Just keep in mind that it'll all pass... and as Unique has said, medication now completely controls most of the side effects ...  Emends is truely a WONDER DRUG.  With emends, no vomiting/no nausea.  Ask your onc. if you can take it before you start.  It makes a world of a difference.  If there's anything we can do to help, just let us know.  I wish we were all closer in distance.  I would've come over and helped you out during my good days.  Take it easy on yourself and good luck. two days away before #3 .. nervous and anxious to get it over with at the same time.  Enjoy your day everyone!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2008 10:39AM Fammy5 wrote: welcome back Cheryl... glad to hear that you're ok...  for the bone pain, motrin really worked for me... if tylenol doesn't work for you cheryl, try motrin..  it made a world of a difference with me the second round... good luck and i'm sure you'll do great! unique.. sorry to hear about your cough.  I don't know what it might be. Sorry i can't help you there   hopefully it'll go away soon.. if it doesn't, then speak to your onc.! I go in for number 3 tomorrow   i'm so nervous.  Hoping this time around, I don't get sick.  On the positive side, once I finish tomorrow, i'll only have one more round of A/C !! then onto Taxol.. which I heard is much more tolerable than A/C.  (i hope)  Bourscheid.. it definitely feels good when students I taught years ago come and visit and check up on me.  I stopped by the school yesterday to help the sub out a bit (the kids are driving her nuts!!)  and report cards for the first marking period are due next week.  She's new to all this and is very overwhelmed.. so I went in to help her out a bit in the afternoon.. and was pleasantly surprised to see some of my students (whom I taught years ago) stop by and visit with gifts and flowers   It was a great feeling!  I miss teaching a lot! Hope everyone else is feeling alright.. Hang in there ladies.. time is flying by and before we know it, we'll be done with this soon!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2008 05:08PM Fammy5 wrote: Hello Ladies.. I think there is a misunderstanding.  I finished A/C on Monday but i still have 12 rounds of Taxol.. I start on December 31st.. I pray that Taxol is easier on me than A/C.  I'm 5 days out and i'm still feeling miserable.. I hope I snap out of it soon! Congrats to all those who are done ! I need to go nap again.. Love, Fammy
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2008 03:29AM Fammy5 wrote: I've been reading posts on this website ever since I was diagnosed back in July.  Today I found out that i'll be starting chemo on the 2nd of October, and I decided to log on and start the "october" thread! .. I was wondering if I was going to find the same support and same number of ladies join the "october group" as I found in the previous months!  As soon as I logged on, I realized that someone had already started for this upcoming month and my face just lit up!  Let me introduce myself.  I'm 32 with three beautiful children (two boys and a girl).. and a loving husband of 12 years...  diagnosed with breast cancer on July 28, left mastectomy on August 26, and finally took the step of starting chemo next week.  I'm extremely nervous because of the "unknown".. yet at the same time I have this inner peace knowing that i'm actually doing something about all of this and not just sitting there waiting for the worst... I'll be doing AC x 4, then Taxol x 4 ... dose dense.. I guess meaning every two weeks... I am dreading the hair loss part of all of this... yet i'm also worried about the other SE's .. I will be given the neulasta shot the day after each treatment... heard it has SE's of it's own... a little concerned about that as well... If there's any info any of us find that might help the others, lets share ... i'm nervous yet anxious to get this all over with... i'm happy I found you guys... Fammy...
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2008 09:13PM Fammy5 wrote: threegirlsmom.... congrats on finishing your first chemo!  Tomorrow morning is my first round.  I'm very nervous, but i'm trying to be strong about it! Hopefully i'll get some sleep tonight.  you're all in my thoughts and prayers.  Wish me luck in the morning...
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2008 04:45PM Fammy5 wrote: Good Afternoon Ladies...  Well, 1 down and 3 more AC to go... It wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be.  Felt a little dizzy and light headed... then i was ok... then i felt real nauseated.. and just let it all out :(  I called them at the center to let them know and i'm waiting for the doctor on call to call me back and tell me what i should do...  i'm feeling much better now that it's out of my system. just got off with the doctor while posting to u guys and he told me to take a compazine .. we'll c..  hopefully it'll be ok.  Will keep you guys posted as the day goes by.  Will go nap a bit. waiting to hear from u all and hoping you are all doing well!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2008 02:19PM Fammy5 wrote: congratulations bourscheid! I know how that feels!   i'm not looking forward to my second chemo next thursday   I had it real rough the first time, vomiting non-stop once I got home and bone pain.  It was pretty bad.  Now I have a cold that i'm trying to fight.  The nurses at the cancer are very kind and constantly call me to make sure i'm "ok".  They actually said they'd write a note to the doctor so he can change my anti-nausea medication and possibly lower my dosage for the neulasta shot so i'm not in so much pain!  The recipes sound delcious! thanks ggoff! Hoping you're all having a better day than I am!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2008 03:23PM Fammy5 wrote: Hello beautiful ladies...  This is definitely a rollercoaster ride, isn't it? I had another breakdown yesterday.. very nervous about the chemo...  which starts on thursday for me.  I got on my knees last night and prayed to God, and it worked.. i'm feeling much better today (emotionally) ... my best friend just called me and told me that she shaved her head off!!   It was a pleasant surprise.  She's actually at the mall and is picking up some bandanas for me also.  I think I need to buzz my hair soon too.  Have my MUGA test on Monday, and PET scan on Tuesday.  Already had a CAT scan and MRI back in August.  TNT: I already bought Biotene mouthwash for the cold sores.  Supposedly, it works very well.  As for the neuropathy, many ladies who have gone through this before mentioned tea tree oil.  They say it really works.  For those of us who are taking the Neulasta shot, i'm hearing that Claritin works for the bone pain.  My onc. said aleve or advil should be fine.  I'm going to buy Claritin just in case the advil or aleve don't do the job.  Does anyone know if they give you steroids when taking the AC dose dense ?? i'm hearing that keeps u awake all night   any info on that? Enjoy the rest of your weekend ladies... Fammy
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2008 09:56AM Fammy5 wrote: good morning ladies... can't talk for long but wanted to give u an update! i was in the office yesterday for four hours.. and as they were calling me to go in and get my infusion, the lady taking care of the insurance came up to me and said that my insurance was terminated!!! unfortunately i wasn't able to continue yesterday!! :(  however, it worked out for the better because I woke up this morning with a fever and a sore throat!! so maybe God did this so I can deal with this cold first, and take the infusion when i'm feeling better next week... I Rescheduled for friday the 10th... I met all the nurses yesterday and they were amazing... they really made me feel more at ease and i came home with a completely different outlook... God willing it will be a smooth ride for all of us... gotta run, but i'll talk to u guys again later! Love, Fammy
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2008 05:37PM Fammy5 wrote: Hey ladies..  so sorry i've been out of the loop the past few days.. things have been very hectic on this end.  Between work, and home, and managing/dealing with all the side effects of my first chemo (which didn't go too well if some of you remember).  I do come online every day though and read each and every post, which always puts a smile on my face because I know i'm not the only one going through this.  Unfortunately, I caught a cold last week (the "good" week) and had to go see my oncologist and my counts were extremely low.  I lost my voice and was in pain.  He gave me a whole bunch of antibiotics and i'm feeling much much better.  I just can't believe that it's all going to start again tomorrow (my 2nd round) .. hopefully this time it won't be as bad as the first time.  They will add Emend to my medication "cocktail" this time, so hopefully I won't be vomiting like last time.  I'm waiting for my hair to start falling out but trying not to think about it too much. Finally bought my first wig and it looks pretty cute   My husband and kids loved it.  Once the hair starts falling out, i'll buzz it.  Welcome to all the newbies on the list! Hopefully we'll all get through this together.  We'll have our bad and good days, but it'll all pass! bourscheid, I love the new pic! How's school and the kids?? I got sick last week thinking it might be cause it was really my first official week of working with the kids.  I loved being back though! I feel so in control when i'm teaching!  I have hand sanitizers and tissue boxes EVERYWHERE.  and no one is allowed to hug me ... they all know that... but i still got sick Good luck lindbad and kimmysue tomorrow... i'll be thinking of you two as I get my second treatment done! ... If everything goes well tomorrow, i'll be halfway done with A/C!! then four rounds of taxol ! Fammy have a great day gals, waiting to hear from you!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2008 09:33AM Fammy5 wrote: Hi ladies... I hope everyone is doing well today.. bluedasher:  I'm so sorry to hear about your port episode.  One positive way to look at it is that it's over now, and you can rest at home.  The worst part of all of this is the anticipation and waiting for everything to be over with.  jill... it's crazy how each and every oncologist has a different perspective.  my tumor was about 1.5cm, and one positive lymph node.. so the first oncologist i went to said only four rounds of A/C, then tamoxifen for five years.  The oncologist i'm with now (i felt more comfortable with him and i loved the facility.. very clean and organized)... he said that I should do four rounds of A/C, then four rounds of Taxol, and every six months go in for one shot of something to stop my periods.  Thank God i have three kids, so i'm not upset about not getting my periods any longer.  I am Her2 negative, so I guess that's why the Herceptin isn't needed.  I'm just happy that i'm halfway done with A/C.  Today is day 2, and i'm feeling ok... a little nauseated, and weak, but other then that, i'm ok.. the Emend really made a world of a difference.  I can't believe how bad it was my first time around. Bourscheid... how are you?  haven't heard from you in a while.  Hope all is well and your students aren't driving you nuts! I took off yesterday and today and hopefully i'll be back with them on Monday! Kimmysue... that's great news... ! I'm so happy for you.. and i'm glad that your first tx went well! where are the rest of you who had chemo yesterday? anxious to hear from you and wishing you well.  Keep in touch ladies.. will post more later..  Fammy
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2008 10:10AM Fammy5 wrote: Hi ladies.. Hope everyone is doing well.  I haven't been on for a while.  It's been rough on this end. Unique... I was supposed to go in yesterday, but the oncologist told me that my body can't handle A/C every two weeks, so he moved me to every three weeks.  So my next tx is on the 13th of this month (next thursday).  Kinda stinks but I'd rather have a week of feeling "normal" than not having any days at all.  He also said that he doesn't think the neulasta shot is working for me cuz I collapsed days 7 and 8 both times... this last time I got a bad gum infection with several mouth sores ... it's been real rough.  He put me on more antibiotics and two mouthwashes.. they helped thank God.. The antibiotics were real strong and I wasn't eating anything because of my mouth sores.. so the vomiting was pretty bad early this week.  To be honest, i'm a little disappointed in myself for not being stronger, but it's not in my hands.  I was hoping i'd get this over with sooner, but I guess this is better for my system.  Next time I go in, I have to tell my onc that i'm not willing to go through what i've been through and it's his responsibility to help me get through this a bit easier than what i've been going through... am I asking for too much?? I'm finally eating.  I've been living on liquids the past week.  I still have a sore on my tongue (??).  It hurts, but it's healing thank God.  i'm going to make the best out of this coming week before my next round on thursday.  thanks for listening, Fammy
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2008 10:15AM Fammy5 wrote: one question ladies... has anyone's eyebrows/eyelashes started falling out? my hair was falling out bad last week, so I took the initiative and shaved it all off.. (i shaved everything else also!!! didn't want to deal with the mess of it all falling out) I feel free now.    hoping that my eyelashes and eyebrows stay, but not sure about that... bourschied...  I had to stop working   my onc said it's better for me to stay away from the kids for now until I at least finish the A/C part of my treatment.  I miss them a lot, but i'd rather be safe than sorry!

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2008 05:27PM Fammy5 wrote: good for you unique.. keep it up..  i'm hoping this coming thursday goes smoothly for me.. i'm trying to enjoy every minute of feeling "myself" ... enjoying my kids especially and quality time with my hubby... I know myself.. once it hits me on thursday, i'll be out for a while.. good luck to all of you, and thanks for always listening... fammy :)

My last A/C is tomorrow!! I don't know whether to be happy about it or dread all the side effects.  Three weeks after that is Taxol! Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2008 09:40AM Fammy5 wrote: hello ladies... sorry i haven't posted in a while... had A/C #3 on wednesday. only one more A/C to go thank God.  I'm actually feeling better this time around.  Knocked out the first few days, but i'm doing ok now.  Hopefully it'll keep getting better.  I'm starting to worry about the next part of my treatment.  Taxol.    My onc. decided that since i didn't do so well with A/C, he wants to give me Taxol once a week for 12 weeks, instead of once every two weeks.  He's assuming that I won't react too well to Taxol and wants to lower the dosage.  We'll see.. Have a great day everyone.  I need a nap :) unique... as soon as I find out when my next round is, i'll let you know.  I think it'll be on December 10, but not sure!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2008 07:32AM Fammy5 wrote: Happy "belated" thanksgiving ladies..  Unique.. i'm so sorry about the car accident, but thanking God that you are safe.  You mentioned in your last post that you were on Augmentin for a cough.  How many mg if you don't mind me asking.  I'm on Augmentin now and it's 875 mg, and i dread taking it each time! it upsets my stomach and I feel extremely weak after taking it! sobx.. sorry to hear about the "rash".  I hope you're feeling better ... My whole family came over for thanksgiving and it was one of the best thanksgivings i've ever had.  I really wanted to feel well this thanksgiving and enjoy time with my family and thank God my prayers were answered.  Even though I crashed on wednesday and wasn't feeling well at all, I felt completely "myself" yesterday and enjoyed every minute of it.  I hope everyone's thanksgiving was a good one.  We all have a lot to be grateful for! hugs to all, fammy

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2008 04:09PM Fammy5 wrote: hello ladies.. How are all of you? Hoping everyone is doing well and had/is having a great weekend.  I had a great day yesterday.  Went to visit some family in upstate NY and the drive was absolutely gorgeous! the mountains and the leaves changing colors brought a big smile to my face.  Now i'm home, about to start cleaning and prepare everything the kids need for school this week.  I start working again on tuesday, then first tx on friday... a little nervous but anxious to start and get this over with. Bourscheid:  How are you feeling?  hopefully you're still doing well ! i've been thinking of you and praying that you're experiencing minimal se's... if I had started on thursday with you, we would've been in the same boat right now :(  keep us posted everyone who has started.. don't be lazy! enjoy your sunday and will check on you guys in a bit! off to some cleaning...

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2008 05:50PM Fammy5 wrote: Hello Ladies...  How are you all today? hope everyone is doing well.  I had my second treatment today.... (please add me to the list).  They gave me emend, and yes it helped a lot and made a big difference.  I'm a little unbalanced... but it's all manageable... nothing major thank God... i'm doing four rounds of A/C... just finished my second one today, and my next one is November 6th.  Then Taxol x 4.  Will go rest a bit.  Kimmy, Lindbad, Cheryl and Kathi, hope your day was smooth.  Plakatakr, good luck tomorrow... talk to u all later!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2008 08:49AM Fammy5 wrote: Hey lovely ladies... It took me a while to catch up to all your posts... but i've read each and every one of them.  Welcome aboard to all the new heroes.  Yes, we are heroes.  Not anyone can go through what we're going through.  God is testing our patience, and we will pass.   I had my second round of AC on the 23rd.  Took Emend this time around, and it does in fact do miracles.  I was fine the first two days with no SE's.  Then it hit me saturday and sunday.  Very weak, and sleeping all day.  Went to work on Mon., Tues., Wed., and Thurs.  Thursday I started collapsing.  I almost fainted in school, and I had a horrible toothache (what I thought).  Went to the dentist and said that I have an infection and need to pull out my wisdom tooth! (do i really need this now?) .. Of course have to get the approval of the oncologist.  Went straight to his office and he said "you're not touching that tooth" ... my WBC count was extremely low.  He didn't even think it was my tooth.  He said it's a bad gum infection.  Of course at that point,  I couldn't eat, drink, sleep, or talk.  He put me on another set of antibiotics, several mouthwashes, and of course pain killers and told me that there's no way I can handle another AC this coming thursday.  He's moving me to once every three weeks.  I'm glad I only have two more AC to deal with.  So my next one is on November 13th.  Unique- you've done a fabulous job with our schedule.  Keep it up, we all definitely appreciate your time and effort! I finally buzzed my hair (felt so free afterwards).  Been wearing cute hats and wigs my sisters have bought me.  Can't wait till this is all over! Thanks for listening ladies.. you're a great support!  Good luck to everyone going in this week.  I pray that you have an easy week with no SE's... Fammy
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2008 08:28PM Fammy5 wrote: Hello ladies.. It's been a while since I posted, but I do in face log on every day at least once and read all your posts.  The positive attitude that shines from each and every one of you makes me speechless sometimes.  It always gives me that extra push that I need to pick up and keep moving.  I can't believe how expensive all this medication can be.  I am fortunate that I only pay $25 for 3 pills of Emend.  unique:  I'm so sorry about the bruises.  definitely call your oncol. tomorrow and find out what's going on... i've noticed that there's always something "new" going on with each tx.   bourscheid: you deserve to spoil yourself and buy all the dangly earrings you want.  I've done the same myself and they compliment the bald head   I went and visited my students on friday for a bit.. it was really nice seeing them.  I miss them a lot. sobx:this might be a silly question, but where do you buy those pressure bands for seasickness?  Just any pharmacy? rite aid? cvs?  i'm glad you're doing fine.  kathi:  hope you're feeling better today ... I was supposed to get my 3rd tx on thursday! When my oncol. saw me, he said that my gum infection didn't heal 100% and wanted me to take another week off !  I don't know if that's good or bad anymore.  It's been more than 3 weeks since my 2nd tx, and i'm starting to panic.  My oncol. said that it won't affect anything, it'll just give me more time to feel better.  So HOPEFULLY i'll go in on wednesday and get my 3rd tx over with!  He also suggests that instead of taking dose dense taxol every other week four times, he wants to lessen the dosage and give me taxol every week for 12 weeks.  He's concerned that I won't react well since I haven't reacted well with the A/C.  I don't know what to do.  Any suggestions?  Everyone in previous groups have said that taxol is much easier to tolerate than A/C.  I want to get this all over with, yet at the same time, if it's going to be easier to deal with the side effects with a lower dosage, then i'll do it.  I want to go back to work and return to my "normal" life again asap.  Thanks for listening. Good luck to all having chemo this week.

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2008 06:24PM Fammy5 wrote: Hi ladies.. had my last A/C on monday and i crashed today ... the only thing keeping me going is the fact that it was my last one!  i'm very weak right now and have been sleeping all day ... I hope it doesn't get worse!  Sorry to hear about your son Unique.. hope he feels better soon! and hope you feel better soon too! Deb.. congrats on your last A/C also!! :) isn't it a great feeling?? I start weekly taxols also on December 31st!  let me know how it goes with u.. i'm nervous about it! Hope everyone else is doing well! i'll try to post more often! love, Fammy
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2008 11:25AM Fammy5 wrote: i'm sorry for intruding.... seeing the bond that you ladies have created puts a sense of relief inside of me...  God bless all of u!  I was diagnosed with breast cancer about two months ago... dcis and idc stage 2 .. it was a nightmare at first, but i've somewhat adjusted and taking it day by day. I had a mastectomy on August 26th.. wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be... went to one oncologist about a week ago and about to see a second oncologist on monday for a second opinion.. the first doctor suggested four rounds of cytoxan and something equivalent to adriamycin.. and then five years of tamoxifen... lets see what the second doctor says.. I've been reading the posts on here for a while and to be honest with you, it's all your words that put my heart at ease to some extent.  I read the "starting chemo in september" group and the optimism i've found surprises me..  Many of the ladies are stating that it's not as bad as they thought it was going to be.. i'm hoping that's my case as well... I intentionally came to this group because I see that you fine ladies started a while ago.. and i'm hearing that the first chemo is the easiest, the second is harder, the third gets harder and the fourth is the hardest...  is this a common issue? and what do people mean by harder?? the nausea?? the fatigue?? what exactly?? and how bad is this neulasta shot?? the september group is great... but they just started ... i'm wondering how you ladies are holding up after starting back in may...   i'm 32 and a mother of 3.. have a full time job and am praying to God that I can still be able to work while taking the chemo... any feedback would be greatly appreciated.. and once again, i apologize for intruding.. thanks...
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo May 2008 KristyAnn Nico1012

Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2008 10:30AM Fammy5 wrote: thanks a lot guys... I really do appreciate all your input... I can't wait to look back at all of this when it's all over! Keep your prayers coming... thx! :) Good luck to all of you.. and once I find out when exactly I start chemo, i'll start another group.. possibly the october group... we'll c!  It's so much easier going through something so hard when you know others are going through the same thing!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo May 2008 KristyAnn Nico1012
